intro: Gymnanthelia lanigera, commonly known as the woolly gymnanthelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Gymnanthelia lanigera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks.
